Billionaire Jack Ma Says Alibaba Will Change As Chinese Rival PDD Catches Up
He was responding to employees’ discussions on how PDD Holdings may soon overtake Alibaba in terms of market capitalization.
By
Yue Wang
Senior Contributor
Nov 17, 2023

Alibaba Loses $21 Billion In Market Value After Suspending Cloud Unit IPO And Jack Ma Sells Shares
Alibaba Group stunned investors when it announced that it would suspend the listing plan of its cloud computing unit, while also revealing that cofounder Jack Ma intends to sell some of his shares.
By
Yue Wang
Senior Contributor
Nov 8, 2023

Jack Ma’s Alibaba Group Looks Ahead With Business Split, Reshuffle At Top
The Alibaba cofounder’s wealth rose to $25.1 billion following his return to China.
By
Shu-Ching Jean Chen
Contributor
Jul 7, 2023

China Fines Jack Ma’s Ant Group Nearly $1 Billion
The penalties conclude a years-long probe by the People’s Bank of China into Ant Group, founded by billionaire Jack Ma.
By
Ty Roush
Forbes Staff
Jun 19, 2023

Alibaba Billionaire Jack Ma Steps Back Into Spotlight—But As A Teacher, Not A Tech Mogul
Ma, formerly China’s richest person, has largely disappeared from public life since criticizing Beijing’s regulators in 2020.
By
Robert Hart
Former Staff
May 3, 2023

Alibaba Founder Jack Ma Returns To Public Life In Universities Outside Of Mainland China — SCMP
Charismatic figure has professorships in Hong Kong, Tokyo, Tel Aviv and Kigali, newspaper says
By
Russell Flannery
Senior Contributor
Mar 27, 2023

Billionaire Jack Ma Returns To China To Visit Private School In Hangzhou
Jack Ma has finally returned to mainland China after spending more than a year traveling abroad, just as authorities have begun to show signs of easing their crackdown on the internet sector and issued supportive messages to private entrepreneurs.
By
Yue Wang
Senior Contributor
Feb 24, 2023

Jack Ma Loses His $3 Billion Gain As Investors Worry About Alibaba’s Growth Outlook
Jack Ma's wealth gain for the year all but evaporated, after Alibaba’s stock was dragged lower on renewed worries over the company’s growth prospects.
